CCFDPC.info

Fire Department
Pump Chart Calculator

This is a single-page progressive web app designed with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Bootstrap that inporperates all the content from the CCFD Pump chart into an easy to use application.

Instead of searching through the chart, items are presented in easy to use buttons with dropdown menus.

The items are then displayed near the bottom of the chart and calculated outputing the final engine pressure at the bottom.

web app

SNFO.info

Interactive IC
Worksheet

This is a progressive web app designed with PHP, CSS grid and Bootstrap that replaces the SNFO IC Worksheet paper form.

All inputed items are stored using localStorage so when the incident has ended, the user can send a compiled report via email.

Additionaly, the app utilizes the Google maps API to display a real-time image of the location of the incident and is available as a Windows app through the MicroSoft™ Store.

MicroSoft Store
 web app

CCEMP.info

Interactive
Protocol Reference

This is a progressive web app designed with PHP and Bootstrap that enables users to not only reference the Southern Nevada Health District's EMS protocols but also stores and timestamps any clicked event.

These are stored via localStorage until the user moves to the report page where the patient info can be added and a incident report is compiled.

The report can then be sent via text or email.

All information is purged when the report is sent.

A weight and Ketamine calculator were added to the app as well as shock counter and Epi timer to the Cardiac Arrest Protocol.

 web app

CCFDInfo.site

Patient Information

This is a simple progressive web app designed with PHP and Bootstrap that enables users to record patient information on the go.

Everyone has a phone and if all else fails, this app alows the user to record information until the proper device is available

The infomation is timestamped and compiled when the user clicks OK.

It can then be sent via text or email.

All information is purged after sending.

web app

BeautifulMedSpaLv.com

This is a basic web site using Mobirise generator built for a friend.

about me...

  After many fine years and approaching the end of my fire career, I found myself rediscovering a long-lost verneration for computers. Coding in particular. A few courses that I've taken include Codecadamy, FreeCodeCamp, Wes Bos, Scrimba, Udemy, edX and Flavio Copes to name a few. Some of the works I studied are Kyle Simpson and Jon Stokes. I am currently persuing a BS computer in science at CSN.


  Embarking on an effort to bring the fire service into the modern age, I set about looking for applications that could be made better by digitalizing them, namely the disproportionate amount of perishable paper forms that were in use.


  Typically a fire department device is allocated to only one application so why not utilize these to their full potential? Thus, the IC worksheet, info and Protocol apps were created.


  My department began to use a semi-automatic staffing program that has a painful mobile interface and so was the impetus for Telescraper.


All the work you see here, including this site that these applications are presented on, was built and is maintained by myself exclusively. The only assitance I received was from the aforementioned and the omnipotent Google.


 I would love the opportunity to assist you and your department or company with stepping into the future. I have the hands-on experience to understand the nuances of the job to make applications not only ‘firefighter proof’ but fundamentally usable. Please let me know how I can move your organization forward.
